features.additionalInfo: Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
You can access your money using your CommBank keycard or Debit Mastercard, in branch or online in NetBank and the CommBank app.
There is no minimum balance needed for the offset to be applied to your home loan.

Maximise the benefits of offsetting by linking multiple Everyday Offsets to a Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan, provided they're in the name(s) of the loan borrowers. Each Everyday Offset can only be linked to one home loan at a time. Existing eligible CommBank accounts can be switched to an Everyday Offset.

An Everyday Offset can be linked to your Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan. Any money you put into your Everyday Offset reduces the balance on which we charge interest. However, you do not earn interest on the balance in your Everyday Offset, even if the balance exceeds the balance of the home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Available to personal customers with a Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan.
Everyday Offset must be in the same name(s) as the borrowers on the home loan. You can open an Everyday Offset in your name or jointly with your Co-Borrower(s).

fees.name: Unpaid cheque or debit fee
fees.additionalInfo: When we dishonour a cheque or debit presented to us because there isn't enough money in your account.

fees.name: Unpaid scheduled payment fee
fees.additionalInfo: If you don't have enough money in your account for a payment or transfer you scheduled - we try to make the payment or transfer on five successive business days before charging you. This does not include Scheduled Payments that you arrange between your individual and/or joint accounts.

fees.name: Transaction listing or ad-hoc paper statement fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for paper copies of your transaction listing, past statements or ordered statements.

fees.name: Overdraw fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you exceed the available funds in your account or any agreed overdraft limit on a given day. Additional interest may apply on overdrawn amounts.

fees.name: CBA ATM cash withdrawals in Australia
Account fee
fees.additionalInfo: There is no Monthly Account Fee.

fees.name: Paper Statement Fee - Standard Cycle
fees.additionalInfo: There is no charge for paper statements issued within our standard cycle (six months).

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas purchases
fees.additionalInfo: Purchases made overseas or in Australia (e.g. online), where the merchant is located overseas or the financial institution or entity processing transaction is located overseas.

fees.name: Cheque negotiated fee
fees.additionalInfo: When you write a cheque that needs to be negotiated through the clearing system.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas ATMs
fees.additionalInfo: When you take money out at ASB ATMs in NZ or CommBank ATMs outside Australia.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas cash withdrawals
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawals overseas will incur a $5.00 fee plus 3% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas cash withdrawals
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawals overseas will incur a $5.00 fee plus 3% of the transaction value.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: The interest rate that applies on overdrawn amounts. This is calculated daily and charged monthly/quarterly.

data.name: Everyday Offset
data.description: Everyday Offset is a transaction account which is linked to an eligible home loan, and account holder(s) must also be account holders of the linked home loan. Interest is not charged on the part of the Home Loan balance equal to the Transaction account. Full terms and conditions for transaction and savings accounts are available at CommBank.com.au or from any branch of the Commonwealth Bank. Fees and charges apply.
